docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: XAMPP Development Environment PHP is a server side language, so we can only see how it runs when we start the local server. For that, we can install XAMPP , a web server stack consisting of PHP, MariaDB and Apache Server. It is available in Windows, Mac and Linux. Start Up After launching the app, at the General tab, click Start to start the XAMPP virtual machine. Then we can go to the Service tab and start the required services. Enable Remote Access to phpMyAdmin To access phpMyAdmin , a browser admin service for MySQL/MariaDB, at the General tab, click Go to Application . This opens a browser where the top right tab goes to it. However, on first launch, access to it is blocked by default. Steps to unblock is shown at the HOW-TO Guide tab at the same page. Essentially, we need go into the VM to change some config files. This can be done at the General tab, Open Terminal . Within the terminal, install an editor like nano. apt-get update apt-get install nano Creating a Database
